pr_title: [core] Generify GenericToken, cleanup Token managers & CPD

timeline.message: Fix file name for token manager error
Do it for the other languages
Fix other generic uses of GenericToken
Make Antlr token manager throw TokenMgrError directly
Make Antlr token implementation respect its contract

timeline.bodyText:
What is the meaning of the package "impl"? I see this very often. Is there a difference between "internal" and "impl"? I think, we should stick at some point to one name...
The class AntlrToken is now moved from package net.sourceforge.pmd.cpd.token to net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.impl.antlr4. This is a breaking API change, but one that can be fixed with "organize imports". Is it worth to do any deprecation warning on master for that change?
timeline.author: adangel
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,8 +1,8 @@
-/**
+/*
  * BSD-style license; for more info see http://pmd.sourceforge.net/license.html
  */
 
-package net.sourceforge.pmd.cpd.token;
+package net.sourceforge.pmd.lang.ast.impl.antlr4;

replies.bodyText:
I described this here
So ast.impl.antlr4 would be a package relevant for language implementors to use, while  ast.internal should not be used outside of pmd-core, and ast is relevant to everyone.
I'm not sure it's sensible to deprecate on master, since the API will still be here and easy to reach. Maybe we should mention this in the 7.0 release notes though
replies.author: oowekyala

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we should move CppCharStream then into a internal package? I think, this is just an implementation detail and API users should not need to care about it....
